body.name: RØDE NT-USB Mini Versatile Studio-quality Condenser USB Microphone with Free Software for Podcasting, Streaming, Gaming, Music Production, Vocal and Instrument Recording,Black
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 15 mins
features: The NT-USB Mini brings the pristine sound quality of RØDE’s world-class studio mics to a compact, easy-to-use USB microphone
Features a sound signature tailored specifically to deliver warmth and presence in your recordings and will sound amazing on dialogue, vocals, guitar – anything you throw in front of it
The studio-grade headphone amplifier and high-quality 3.5mm headphone output, complete with precision volume control, allows you to easily monitor your audio
Unique integrated digital signal processing gives access to a noise gate, compressor, APHEX Aural Exciter and Big Bottom (accessed via free RØDE Connect software for PC / Mac)
Perfect for all applications - from podcasting and music recording to Zoom calls
body.description: The NT-USB Mini is a compact, studio-quality USB microphone designed for recording direct to a computer or tablet. It is simple to set-up and use, and a smooth frequency response and directional pickup pattern make the NT-USB Mini perfect for recording vocals and instruments, livestreaming and gaming, podcasting, voice calls and more. The included desk stand features a magnetic base that can be detached for easy mounting on mic stands or studio arms, and with its in-built pop filter and zero-latency headphone monitoring, the NT-USB Mini delivers crisp, clear audio in all recording applications.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Capture crystal clear, professional quality audio direct to a computer or tablet with the NT-USB Mini. Whether you're a gamer, podcaster, musician, streamer or content creator, this is the perfect microphone for you.
With a directional polar pattern that is optimised to reduce the sound of the room around you, the NT-USB Mini will give you beautifully clear recordings that are focused and detailed.
LIsten to your audio in real-time with no distracting delay or echo using the NT-USB Mini's high quality USB output, complete with onboard volume control.

Want to record professional quality podcasts with ease? The NT-USB Mini is fully compatible with the FREE RØDE Connect podcasting software for Mac and PC, which makes recording high quality simple, even if you have no audio experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent! Greatly improves sound of iphone as external mic
reviews.reviewText: If you are doing a Facebook live you already know how mediocre the audio sounds using your iPhone. For some reason it cuts out, drops out, has poor quality. You need an external mic to sound really good and THIS one blew me away. I have a career in professional broadcasting and cannot stand poor audio quality and looked long & hard for an external mic to try hooking up to my iPhone. This is as good as it gets at this price point, you will love it. And it feels solid, it is metal, not cheapo plastic. Yes the little plastic tripod is annoying and you will do much better with an actual mic stand, as this tripod tips over easily. But you're buying a good mic, not a stand, so don't let that stop you from getting this truly impressive mic. Poscasters, this will be good for you too. Yes it is pricey but you know how it is, you have to pay for quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best USB Mic - Period
reviews.reviewText: This mic rivals my Lewitt XLR mics (with a Motu M2).It's really nice to just have something that records with such high quality that can be plugged in - in just a matter of 2 seconds via USB C. Absolutely amazing for my voice-overs. The Rode Central software is super easy and plun n' go. I'm not a big fan of the aural and big bottom exciters, but the compressor and high pass filter are top-notch. They work at the same time I'm recording using Audacity which is a huge plus.All metal designmade in Australia (yes, not China)24bit 48khz sample rate recording (you don't need more than that)driverless (as far as I am aware)USB C cable is firm and heavyPop filter get's the job donestand is nicelights up a blue LED on the side that records sound (looks nice)super low noise and high gain (pretty impressive for USB actually)Mid-range is the sweetest I have ever heard for a mic (perfect for voice)I have no complaints. My mic came in damage free, so I am not sure what happened to the other reviewers mics. Not fair to give it 1 star, though. This mic screams quality outside in. The fact that Rode makes this mic in Australia tells me that they are really proud of it, and I can see why. Well worth the cost, as it's a weird mic that is super beginner friendly (it's plug and forget USB) and 'End-Game' (the quality is that impressive IMHO).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 4 Years, Going Strong
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this mic for 4 years for work Zoom calls, Youtube videos, podcasts, everything. It makes my voice clear and perfect. I don't leave reviews often but this mic is worth every penny. It was $99 when I bought it in 2020 and it's still $99. Can't imagine that there's a better value mic out there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars One of the best small USB Mics you can buy
reviews.reviewText: Overall this a great little mic if you need some small for voice.Pros:Small sizeHigh quality nylon and aluminum constructionSimple magnetic baseStrong headphone amplifier built in, able to drive many headphones, including those with higher impedance like the MDR V6 at 53ohmsCompact and portableSolid USB C connection with a quality, adequate length included cableCons:Limited to 96khz. People debate this, but 192khz does often sound a bit better to me, though it's not necessary.Somewhat high noise floor - the mic can sound a bit sizzlyIncluded stand is very low, and easily picks up background noise. Depending on your use case you'll almost definitely need to pick up a separate stand that brings the mic within 6 inches of your mouth to take advantage of the proximity effect. You can get an aftermarket stand for not too much money, but frankly I'm not sure why they included such a short stand.Depending on your voice timbre, it can sound somewhat flat and 'robotlike'. This is more a personal problem for since I have a very monotone voice. Different mics can make it sound better.Overall, for the money you really can't go wrong. It's far better than any included headset mic, the headphone amp is very good, and it also sounds pretty decent for acoustic guitar.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works better than expected
reviews.reviewText: I like the sensitivity and pick-up pattern. I was concerned that it might be too directional but it is more forgiving. The desktop stand isn’t stable enough to handle the weight of the microphone unless you tilt the microphone back enough. I replaced that right away, condenser mics don’t like falling on the floor

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive All Around
reviews.reviewText: Other than the clarity, I am very impressed by the mic's ability to pick up my voice at distance; clearly, and without picking up my keyboard, fans, most of my mouse clicks or background noise. The sound processing options that come with the app you get on the website give you good tools for further tuning the filtering and way that your voice comes across.The build quality seems very nice as well, even the legs do not feel shoddy and the unit looks sleek. I do wish I could turn off the blue status light as it is mildly distracting!One thing to note - you need to have a USB C port on your computer for this to work right, if you try a C to A cable it will stop working after a second of recording for some strange reason.

reviews.reviewTitle: Opinião sobre o microfone Rode USB +
reviews.reviewText: Microfone sensacional, australiano com qualidade profissional e portátil, notem que o cabo é USB C , aquele menor arredondado nas duas pontas, longo e de qualidade, para notebook ou computadores mais antigos vai precisar de um adaptador, recomendo.

reviews.reviewTitle: No mete ruido, el preamp está increíble
reviews.reviewText: Desde la construcción, se ve la calidad 5 estrellas.Siento que tiene los beneficios de 1 dinámico que es no meter ruido y los beneficios también de un condensador, mucha potencia y claridad en el sonido, no pude hacer Mejor inversión
Es un buen micrófono. No es inalámbrico, no usa baterías se conecta a los dispositivos por usb y desde ahí se alimenta. El sonido se capta de manera nítida.

Had a great XLR setup at home that required a lot of tweaking to make up for the streaming environment that I was in. It was endless and I was never satisfied with the results.Then Rode comes out with this microphone that allows to save DSP settings and use your own audio mixer solution and I was intrigued. Bit the bullet bought the microphone and I'm extremely content with the results.Using Rode Central , I set the desired settings and just go! Plug, play , forget about it. No more tweaking, great extremely crisp sound and an amazing noise gate that finally removes the extra noise in my environment that other filters and plugins within OBS failed to do and not tax my CPU like crazy.Will always recommend Rode to anyone I speak to. Just in love with the microphone and how great it sounds and no more tweaking!I'm already invested in a BEACN Mix Create for my audio mixing solution, but love the idea I can access Unify as a backup if ever my Mix Unit dies.Highly recommend this microphone if you're in store for a new one.

O microfone realmente cumpre o que promete, tendo um bom alcance cardioide, posso coloca-lo contra uma fonte de ruído que deixa muito fácil a remoção deste nos softwares de edição de áudio (Uso o Adobe Audition para a pós produção).Não tive problemas de compatibilidade com nenhum software e sistema operacional, não ocupa espaço físico, muito bom de equalizar na pós produção e aprimorar frequências tanto graves como médio graves e até mesmo agudos.O retorno da voz é excelente também, muito fácil de ser configurado e ideal para ajuste de posição seja do microfone quanto minha (locutor).Recomendo!
